back:
Reading: めいはく

Meanings:
1. (adjectival nouns or quasi-adjectives (keiyodoshi)) obvious; clear; plain; evident; apparent; explicit; overt

Examples:
1. 何をしなければならないかは明白です。
→ It is clear what must be done.

Reading: あかん, アカン, あかーん

Meanings:
1. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.)) useless; no good; hopeless [commonly used with i-adjective inflections, e.g. あかんかった, あかんくない] (word usually written using kana alone)
2. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.)) cannot; must not; not allowed (word usually written using kana alone)

Reading: いじりまわす

Meanings:
1. (Godan verb with 'su' ending; transitive verb) to tinker with; to fumble with; to fiddle with; to twiddle

Examples:
1. 帽子を弄り回すのはやめなさい。
→ Please stop playing with your hat.

Reading: えい, エイ

Meanings:
1. (noun (common) (futsuumeishi)) ray (any fish of superorder Batoidea) (word usually written using kana alone)

Reading: おしちや

Meanings:
1. (noun (common) (futsuumeishi)) name-giving ceremony

Reading: おだいじに

Meanings:
1. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.)) take care of yourself; get well soon

Examples:
1. くれぐれもお体をお大事に。
→ Please take good care of yourself.

Reading: かもしれない

Meanings:
1. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.)) may; might; perhaps; may be; possibly (word usually written using kana alone)

Examples:
1. あなたの言うことは正しいかもしれない。
→ You could be right, I suppose.

Reading: かもしれません

Meanings:
1. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.)) may; might; perhaps; may be; possibly (word usually written using kana alone; polite (teineigo) language)

Examples:
1. 旅行でこのガイドブックが役に立つかもしれませんよ。
→ This guidebook might be of use to you on your trip.

Reading: かよわい

Meanings:
1. (adjective (keiyoushi)) weak; feeble; delicate; frail; helpless

Examples:
1. 彼女の子どもはか弱かった。
→ Her child was in delicate health.

Reading: がっちりや

Meanings:
1. (noun (common) (futsuumeishi)) tightwad; miser

Reading: きっと, キッと

Meanings:
1. (adverb (fukushi)) surely; undoubtedly; almost certainly; most likely (e.g. 90 percent) (word usually written using kana alone; onomatopoeic or mimetic word)
2. (adverb (fukushi)) sternly; severely [esp. キッと] (word usually written using kana alone; onomatopoeic or mimetic word)
3. (adverb (fukushi)) having no slack; rigid; stiff; tight (word usually written using kana alone; onomatopoeic or mimetic word)
4. (adverb (fukushi)) suddenly; abruptly; instantly (word usually written using kana alone; onomatopoeic or mimetic word; archaic)

Examples:
1. でもよー、オラのおとうさんは良い気しねーよ、きっと。
→ But I don't think Dad would like me to.

Reading: くるびょう

Meanings:
1. (noun (common) (futsuumeishi)) rickets; rachitis

Reading: こちら, こっち, こち

Meanings:
1. (pronoun) this way; this direction [direction close to the speaker or towards the speaker] (word usually written using kana alone)
2. (pronoun) here [place close to the speaker or where the speaker is] (word usually written using kana alone)
3. (pronoun) this (one) [something physically close to the speaker] (word usually written using kana alone)
4. (pronoun) I; me; we; us (word usually written using kana alone)
5. (pronoun) this person [someone physically close to the speaker and of equal or higher status] (word usually written using kana alone)

Examples:
1. こちらへやってくる少年とその犬をごらんなさい。
→ Look at the boy and his dog that are coming this way.

1. 塩をこちらへ取ってもらえますか。
→ Could you pass me the salt, please?

Reading: こなた, こんた

Meanings:
1. (noun (common) (futsuumeishi)) this way; here (word usually written using kana alone)
2. (noun (common) (futsuumeishi)) the person in question; he; she; him; her (word usually written using kana alone)
3. (noun (common) (futsuumeishi)) since (a time in the past); prior to (a time in the future)
4. (pronoun) me
5. (pronoun) you (word usually written using kana alone)

Reading: ことがある

Meanings:
1. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.); Godan verb with 'ru' ending (irregular verb)) (for something) to have occurred; to have done (something) [after the past tense form of a verb] (word usually written using kana alone)
2. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.); Godan verb with 'ru' ending (irregular verb)) (for something) to happen on occasion (word usually written using kana alone)

Examples:
1. 私は彼に会ったことがある。
→ I have met him before.

1. 細菌が病気を引き起こすことがある。
→ Germs can cause sickness.

Reading: ことができる

Meanings:
1. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.); Ichidan verb) to be able (to); to be possible (to) [usu. verb+ことが...] (word usually written using kana alone)

Examples:
1. 緑色植物は自分自身の食物を作ることができる。
→ Green plants can make their own food.

Reading: ことにすると

Meanings:
1. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.)) perhaps; maybe; possibly (word usually written using kana alone)

Reading: ことになる

Meanings:
1. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.); Godan verb with 'ru' ending) to have been decided (so) that; to have been arranged (so) that [usu. sentence ending] (word usually written using kana alone)
2. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.); Godan verb with 'ru' ending) to be the result (of); to be the outcome (word usually written using kana alone)
3. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.); Godan verb with 'ru' ending) to be the reason (for) (word usually written using kana alone)

Examples:
1. １週間の休暇を取っても良い事になった。
→ I was allowed to take a week off.

1. 苦労と心配で彼の健康はそこなわれることになった。
→ Toil and worry caused his health to break down.

Reading: ことによって

Meanings:
1. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.)) via; through; by doing; by means of; using (word usually written using kana alone)

Examples:
1. 私は本を読むことによって知識を得る。
→ I get knowledge by reading books.

Reading: このようなばあいに

Meanings:
1. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.); adverb (fukushi)) in this kind of situation

Reading: このばあい

Meanings:
1. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.)) in this case

Examples:
1. この場合は君が悪い。
→ You're wrong in this case.

Reading: このたび, こたび

Examples:
1. このたびはお見のがしくださったらと望んでおります。
→ I hope it will be overlooked this time.

Reading: これとおなじ

Meanings:
1. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.)) the same as this

Reading: しょうべんをする, しょんべんをする

Meanings:

Reading: またあした

Meanings:
1. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.)) see you tomorrow

Examples:

Reading: すきもの

Reading: そうでないばあいは

Meanings:
1. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.)) if this is not the case

Reading: そちら, そっち

Meanings:
1. (pronoun) that way; that direction [direction distant from the speaker, close to the listener] (word usually written using kana alone)
2. (pronoun) there [place distant from the speaker, close to the listener] (word usually written using kana alone)
3. (pronoun) that (one) [something close to the listener] (word usually written using kana alone)
4. (pronoun) you; your family; your company [そちら is polite] (word usually written using kana alone)
5. (pronoun) that person [someone close to the listener] (word usually written using kana alone)

Examples:
1. そちらはセントラル自動車学校ではないんですか。
→ Isn't this Central Driving School?

1. そっちの生活はどうだい？
→ How are things for you up there?

Reading: そのばあいには

Meanings:
1. (expressions (phrases, clauses, etc.)) in that case

Reading: そのつど

Reading: それいじょう

→ He has never been heard of since.

Reading: はたらく
